tweets.text:
It's #FloodActionWeek!

Make it your aim to know what to do in a flood to keep yourself and the things you love safe.

üëâLearn what to do in a flood: https://t.co/yDrqZN037T

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/i10cYZkcUj

Greatham Creek - one of my very fave places for #wildlife watching and superb work done by the @EnvAgency in creating #habitat #wetlands in #teesvalley.  Excellent conference organised by @TeesvalleyLNP - thank you! üôèüåè #ClimateAction #ClimateEmergency #NatureBasedSolutions https://t.co/i7xriyR8Y0

domain.description: Interests, opinions, and behaviors of individuals, groups, or cultures; like Speciality Cooking or Theme Parks

tweets.text: 5.2 million homes and businesses in England are at risk from flooding. While we work closely with @EnvAgency to create solutions which protect those homes it's important to know what to do in a flood #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/IXZgcekiiC https://t.co/vRf0Fw2IjC

Do you know how to survive a flood? Survivalist Megan Hine explains the three things you need to know üëá 

Over 5 million UK homes are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it won't happen to you.

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive

@Meg_Hine https://t.co/Bf3koSXpds

Taking steps to prepare for flooding, and knowing what to do in a #flood can reduce damage to your home and possessions by 40%.

Find out what to do when you receive a flood warning, and download our simple flood plan: https://t.co/ZEHl74ryiJ
#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/F548tn2LzP

urls.title: What to do in a flood - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
We want the Humber to be prosperous in the face of climate change. 

Communities recover quicker from flooding when they have a plan, which is good for the local economy.

Find out more  https://t.co/wwueotBnkz

#PrepareActSurvive #Floodaware

tweets.text:
Did you know. 5.2 million homes and businesses in England are at risk of flooding.

 Are you one of them? Do you know? Don‚Äôt assume it‚Äôs not you.

Check your flood risk for your home or work at: https://t.co/29saU23JrY #prepareactsurvive #FloodActionWeek üè†üåä https://t.co/SK5js60fkd

Having a 'trigger' to notify you of a #flood BEFORE it happens can allow time to prepare.

The @EnvAgencyNW Flood Warning Service is one such trigger, but do you know what the different stages mean?

Read our blog to learn more: https://t.co/5Hv1sflggt

#preparedness #floodaware https://t.co/6lrgoWi2Vw

‚ÄòSignificant risk‚Äô to GP practices over clinical waste firm‚Äôs capacity problems.

https://t.co/rjKtd4QDNf

Today we launched a ¬£200m programme to improve the resilience of communities at risk of #flooding & coastal change. 

25 areas will be selected to receive funding to demonstrate how innovative actions can work, individually and in combination.

Read more https://t.co/Jr6aN8afJ0 https://t.co/m2XzBkSPHP

Works are progressing well on Phase 1 of the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme which will better protect over 2100 homes from flooding once complete. 

More information is available on the Flood Hub https://t.co/gxCTOEbsAK https://t.co/aDaNLpDXMI

"The trade in endangered species is driven by organised crime groups." #Immigration compliance and courts minister.

Good work ‚¨áÔ∏è Keep it up. The fight against #wildlifecrime https://t.co/HNLx7b7E2p

In preparation for winter we've been training contractors to help our incident teams prepare and respond to flooding across the region.

It's #FloodActionWeek Find out what to do in a flood: https://t.co/DqBzBJ52Gp

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ZaGaaolbzu

That was the start of ten years of huge successive budget cuts, the careful placement of leaders at @EnvAgency and @NaturalEngland who wouldn't openly challenge ministers, back office mergers and a near-complete erosion of their independence from central government control

In 2010 the then coalition government under Cameron felt threatened by its environmental regulators @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency and ordered them to stop policymaking & lobbying. The national austerity programme also began with green spending first in line https://t.co/bLvH1W53wZ
It's #FloodActionWeek - a good time to sign up for these webinarsüëç https://t.co/iGIDL8ZJqn

In 2010 the then coalition government under Cameron felt threatened by its environmental regulators @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency and ordered them to stop policymaking & lobbying. The national austerity programme also began with green spending first in line https://t.co/bLvH1W53wZ
This has been coming for a decade and it's difficult to see it as anything other than deliberate. https://t.co/hLYoUF498N

urls.title: LDN Flood Awareness Week
urls.description: Find out if you could be affected by flooding and what you can do to prepare.

tweets.text:
Would you know what to do in a flood? This week is London Flood Awareness Week. We'll be sharing info on
types of flood risk and what you can do to be more prepared. #LDNFloodAware https://t.co/H0ZAfIHTa2 https://t.co/HoeHfnldIE

PS. Why does the @EnvAgency make people visit their local offices just to view these applications?

Can they not simply post them online like everyone else?

So much for openness and transparency.

Look! @wessexwater, who last year spent 107,434 hours dumping sewage into local rivers and on 813 separate occasions dumped sewage into our seas, has just applied to the @EnvAgency for a new sewage dumping permit.

But will the EA refuse the application?

https://t.co/nl5a7W7qo0

tweets.text:
Did you know? 

5.2 million properties in England are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it's not you. 

Know what to do in a flood and #prepareactsurvive ‚¨áÔ∏è

 https://t.co/a5nLshEGSO

#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/yUnf6hyCkC

Why don't you sign up for flood warnings from the @EnvAgency - it's a free service and could save your life!

More information can be found here https://t.co/UHZ1JynKp5

#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/TTdd2XGzys

It's #FloodActionWeek, and I've written a blog on how #TeamEA have been preparing for winter - from building & repairing new flood defences, to enhancing our #FloodWarning system and training 6,500 staff: https://t.co/pVdjmzZUIL

The @EnvAgency is ready for winter, are you?

As well as being Flood Action Week it is also London Flood Awareness Week! 

For more #London flood awareness information follow @LDN_Environment

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek #LDNFloodAware https://t.co/q5MOUjk4s2
